Reviews.Title: “Best reception staff ever”
Reviews.Author: plb20
Reviews.Content: We frequent hotels for work and family reasons, as one daughter plays USTA tennis tournaments. This trip was for a college visit to Butler University, very nice school by the way. We have silver or gold in various chains. I do not recall a hotel stay in the last several years where the front desk staff was so friendly and helpful. The hotel as a very welcoming feel. I took time out of my busy schedule to email the hotel manager about the nice front desk staff, something I typically do not do. Good location, as I was able to walk to downtown restaurants and shopping, and the hotel was just a 10 to 15 minute drive to Butler. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jvg62
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on business. This is a nice hotel near downtown (but still a good walk from all of the main areas of downtown). The canal area is very nice. Rooms were huge and breakfast and evening food and such were top notch. Would definitely stay here again. My only complaint was that the ice cubes continued to be made overnight and spilled over onto the empty freezer deck...which was quite loud. Just a glitch though and nothing to prevent me from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend get a way!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lillian J
Reviews.Content: My stay at the residence Inn On the Canal/January 14,2012 was very nice. The room was wonderful. Only problem I think they over charge for parking $17.00 if we are staying at your facility it should be free and included in the stay

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location for IU Nat”
Reviews.Author: shecar1136
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two night in January 2012 during a swim meet. Our room had just been renovated and was missing a couple items. The staff was very accomodating to get us the items needed. The staff was very friendly any time we walked through the lobby or needed to speak with them. Hot breakfast with waffles, eggs and more. This is right on the channel so we feed the duck and walked the channel. We will definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice rooms in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: Joeram
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 10 consecutive nights starting on the 5th Dec 2011-16th Dec 2011. I LOVED it!!! For the value, the rooms were VERY nice! Good full breakfast every morning plus a small meal at night(usually not too impressive, but free beer). Some of my friends stayed at the Courtyard across the street for the same price and didnt get nearly the same benefits. All the rooms have also been recently remodeled. It's about a 3/4- 1 mile walk to bars and restaurants downtown, or a $5 cab. If you're staying on business for an extended period, I would highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Indianapolis Residence Inn...a great place!”
Reviews.Author: WuSongLong
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property many times over the last 10 years. It is located on the canal, and is within walking distance of many amenities. You can take a scenic walk, or cab very quickly to any destination in Indianapolis. My favorite part of this hotel is the fact that the people are very friendly, and it is very clean. The price is right, and the breakfast is provided. I would also like to compliment the availability of parking. If you have to park a large vehicle, it is very affordable. I routinely take large and small groups to this hotel. The staff will remember you and treat you like a celebrity.

Reviews.Title: “Up to Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy5176
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn on the canal in Indianapolis is a hotel which upholds the Marriott standards, please be advised that they will be going through a remodeling starting 11/01/11. The rooms are fine but a bit outdated, have flat screen TV’s and all the necessary kitchen items. The breakfasts (which are included) are very full and family centered. The location on the canal helps make it accessible to several museums and sites. Also it is near the bike and paddle boat rentals. The pool was just the right size and it has a small hot tub. They also have a pool table which was fun to teach my daughter and she could not leave the table. The staff were great, it was late Friday and we had just come from a show (see report on Mind Tripping) I wanted some milk, and the closest convenience store was 8 blocks away, the desk staff went into the kitchen and gave me 2 cartons, no questions asked. Earlier that day, I had to do a conference call for work, and my family took a nap, when I came back in, they were picking out some snacks at the hotel snack shop, the desk staff did not have a local map of the canal area; I had found one on the web and shared it with them, and he gave my family their treats for free (quid pro quo). The only down point was the $17/day parking. The lot is gated and they give you a card to swipe as you go in and out, but $17 is a bit much. The location is great for many sights and touring, don’t forget to shop websites for the best prices.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: cavamebri
Reviews.Content: We loved being on the canal, very relaxing hearing the sound of the water. Loved the fact the windows opened! The staff are fantastic, extremely friendly and helpful. Tlo top things off, we were provided dinner and wine on Wednesday and Thursday night as well as breakfast. Very relaxed and welcoming atmosphere!!

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Guests”
Reviews.Author: dbka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel for the MotoGP weekend in 2010 and 2011. We loved being there and we plan to stay there again. Although the TV's were dated and the electricity went off for a bit longer than we would have expected, we'll forgive them as the staff and overall hotel stay experience was a comfortable one. Breakfast served early in the morning and on our way in from our time out, they would have fresh baked chocolate chip cookies and lemonade available - a nice treat. We sat on the patio overlooking the Canal where the ducks waded and the paddle boat riders, joggers and cyclists would pass by. We walked to the restaurants close by and even ventured off to the downtown area which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Alternate Home on the Canal”
Reviews.Author: Stella78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the MotoGP and would stay there again. For a busy weekend the staff was on top of things and always made sure to pleasantly acknowledge us as we were coming and going. Check in was easy and the receptionist was polite. Our room was away from the elevators as I had requested and we had a nice view of the canal. Despite the busy weekend and the full hotel we didn't notice a problem with noise. The room was nice and clean, bathroom was clean but was a little tomb-like with it's all white decor. The bed was slightly broken down-I like a really firm mattress though. Wireless worked well-a little slow for netflix streaming though. My only complaint was in the kitchen. I am on a very restricted diet so I have to bring all my food with me and make it in the room. The kitchen was clean-no complaints there and all dishes, pots, pans, cutlery was provided. Didn't use microwave but the full sized fridge and dishwasher were nice. The drawback was with the range. It worked but not efficiently. Took a really long time to cook on the stovetop and it was hard to tell at times if the thing was working. The knob was funky, we couldn't always tell if it was off or on and that didn't give a complete sense of security I didn't mention it until after our stay was over because the place was fully booked and there wouldn't have been anything for them to do. But, it did make us late one day when breakfast took a little too long to cook. Hopefully they will fix this since it's part of the "residence" package. The location is great. We enjoyed a walk on the canal and to downtown. Parking was secure-gated but price really adds up after a day or two. My husband liked the breakfast and coffee was always on. Would stay there again but would check functionality of stovetop first.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pankaj2768
Reviews.Content: I will define the stay at "Homely" since it is a non-formal hotel with basic services in place. The rooms are spacious with full kitchen. What makes this hotel my favourite is the location. This is situated along side the river. On a sunny day, people having jog, families with cycle-rickshaws and pedal boats, with ducks floating in the water make it a very soothing and lively scence Flip side - not all the staff memebers of the hotel are cooperative and sensitive theier patrons but good part is you have a very good ear in the form of its General Manager (Vicki) and she is all there to help whatever best way can be done Proximity to the downtown shopping area, Lucas stadium, Childern's museum and the Zoo (in fact we walked to the zoo from the hotel, along the canal) makes it better to stay

Reviews.Title: “Moving with Pets - Big fee at this location”
Reviews.Author: sastillman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the drive to relocate to Colorado. Marriott is pet friendly and we had our two cats with us. The Non -refundable fee for the pets for one night was $100. We had just stayed in a Kimpton Hotel in our old hometown for four nights while we moved out of our old home. Kimpton charges no fee whatsoever for pets. Other Marriotts charge fees and often adjust them depending on the length of your stay. As I write this we are now in CO waiting to move into our new home and staying in another Marriott that is charging $75 for a 5 night stay. Otherwise, the Indianapolis property was nice...not great. It was dated but very clean and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Garbech
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business trip. Most of our activities took place at the J.W. Marriot and the Convention Center, which were both an easy 10-minute walk from the hotel. Check-in was friendly, and she gave us great advice on some local restaurants to try. Our room was located on the ground level, right on the canal. My only complaint was that there was a lot of noise outside of our room, from people walking along the canal. The room was a 2-bedroom suite, which was great for three of us. The rooms were a little dated (no HDTV, etc) but everything was clean and neat. Overall, it was a great place to stay in downtown Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, poor facility”
Reviews.Author: UConnfan2011
Reviews.Content: What a shock (and disappointment) to have the Marriott name attached to this property. On the plus side, the staff couldn't be nicer...courteous, accommodating and willing. The rooms, however, left much to be desired. Paper thin walls allowed me to hear the occupants walking above and talking in the room next to ours. Those same thin walls also allowed me to know when they were using the bathroom. Not good!!! Also, when the fan/blower kicked in for the AC, it did so with a bang each time. This is not conducive to a good night's sleep. The kitchen area was hopelessly outdated and made me not want to even use the kitchen. The TVs are not flat screen or hi def. It's hard to go backwards on this when you are used to viewing hi def. The TV in the bedroom was basically impossible to watch. This facility is desperately in need of an upgrade. Shame on the Marriott for even letting it get to such a point. For what I paid for my room, it was a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Service combined with location have made this hotel my favorite in Indianapolis.”
Reviews.Author: JMcHale
Reviews.Content: First, the front desk staff go out of their way to make an extended stay like being at home away from home. Cherie, Annette, John and Connie greet you personally to make you feel welcome and go out of their way to assure your comfort during your stay. A simple task such as giving extended stay guests a laundry basket ( cost less than $5 ) instead of those unwieldy plastic bags to carry one's dirty clothes to the laundry room make the stay enjoyable. Second, the hotel is on a canal. Joggers, walkers, bikers etc can be seen every day and in better weather you will see paddle wheel boats, kayaks and an occasional gondola on the water. 2 seater and 4 seater bikes are available in season for rent. A trip around the canal is approx. 3 miles. There are several museums, condos and a college campus for Indiana U and Purdue U on the canal. You are within walking distance of Lucas Oil Stadium, Conseco Fieldhouse, Indiana Repertory Theater and downtown Indy including Circle Center Mall . Free Breakfast is served daily at the hotel and free meals are served several evenings for those too tired to venture out to numerous restaurants also within walking distance.Swimming pool, hot tub and exercise room are also on the premises. I just completed my fourth stay at the hotel and hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things”
Reviews.Author: suncoastrider
Reviews.Content: Simple touches make this hotel stand out. Friendly check in with a welcoming note from management for starters. A problem with the front gate so they eliminate the nightly parking charge when you know most would still insist on it. Coffee at 5 a.m. when breakfast officially starts at 6. (I've literally had other hotel dim the lights in the lobby until the official breakfast time and refuse to turn them on.). This hotel gets it. Treat people like they're at home. Now, for the big things. The room was clean and the bed comfy. The social hour had decent options and plenty of them. The hotel also is centrally located for restaurants and bars and even has a canal walk running behind the property, which is ideal for a little jog or brisk walk.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View of Canal!”
Reviews.Author: famu1989
Reviews.Content: Did overnight trip with family to Indy. Very pleased with this Residence Inn. Located right on the canal. Very relaxing view and good amenities such as billiards room, pool, and fitness rooms. Staff was very friendly and even upgraded our room for us! Parking was steep ($17.00) but found space on street to park for free. Definitely plan to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The nicest staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: GrlsRul
Reviews.Content: We had to be in Indy to go to the Indiana University hospital. We had to bring our little dog along with us. The Residence Inn was the most pet friendly hotel we've ever stayed at. The staff were absolutely wonderful, helpful, and supportive. (Thanks Annette and Courtney!) If we're ever back in Indianapolis again, we will definately stay at the hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great pick!”
Reviews.Author: newbutterfly13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Inn Indianapolis Downtown on the Canal for two nights in August 2010. My stay was excellent! Check-in was very easy and we even asked for a room change to be closer to a friend who was staying there at the same time. The location is very good, being right on the canal. You can go down to the lower level and walk right out to the sidewalk! It's near the highway so it was easy to get back from excersions around town and in downtown, so there was easy access to the sites and resturants there. Rooms were clean and appointed with needed ammenities. One of the televisions in our room was upgraded to a flat screen and one needed to be. Our friends room didn't have either upgraded so that is something they should work on. Breakfast was declious with lots of variety and the fresh cookies in the afternoon were a great treat!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for a couple nights”
Reviews.Author: Bowden68
Reviews.Content: First, what a location. You are right on the canal, and it is amazing. Great place to walk, clean, safe, etc... It's a fairly new development as most of the buildings are new. If you have an afternoon to yourself, bring your walking shoes, plenty to do around the canal. The hotel itself, not bad. The staff could not be friendlier, and the hotel is clean. Two issues: TVs are very small and ancient, and elevators are painfully slow. Ask for a room near the stairwell as it's much quicker to walk. Free hot breakfast. Paking is $17 a day. Safe area. Got it for $45 on night on Priceline. Bourbon Street bar is a block away. Outdoor bar if you are into that. Good greasy food and cold beer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel staff, less than average Marriott hotel”
Reviews.Author: familyof6trip2008
Reviews.Content: Always stay at Marriott Residence Inn's while traveling on business or with family. This Residence Inn did not meet my expectations. It was a wonderful location, wonderful view of the canal and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. We had Marriotts rewards points to use, so the cost of the room was free. I am very glad it was. We stayed in a studio suite, bed was comfortable. The kitchen was dated, marks on the counters, dishwasher set crooked in the wall, very old looking appliances. It did not represent the Marriott name well. The bathroom floor tile was cracked in several places and looked dirty. Carpeting was worn and frayed. I am glad the room price was free, as I would have been very unhappy to spend the money the website advertised for the room. Hotel needs upgrades, NOW!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KArias
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my family for a quick trip to Indy to visit the Children's Museum and the zoo and couldn't decide between the Courtyard and the Residence Inn. Both were in the same complex, but in the end I chose the Residence Inn. The lobby & breakfast area were clean and nicely decorated. The pool was small, but was a perfect size for my two young children. It also had a brand new hot tub. The room we had was a studio, so it has a queen bed and a pull out couch. It was more than enough room for the four of us. It had a small kitchen area with a breakfast bar. It had a very pretty view of the canal. The hotel was located right on the canal, which is about 6-8 blocks from Monument Circle. It was a very scenic walk, especially with the leaves changing colors. The hotel was located a very short drive from the Children's Museum (10 minutes) and zoo (5 minutes). The free breakfast was wonderful! They had the usual items like yogurt, bread/pastries, fruit, juice/coffee, but also had eggs, sausage, potatoes, waffles and oatmeal. The Residence Inn and Courtyard share a parking lot, which charges $12 per night. You do get in & out privlidges, though. We loved the hotel and would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “super friendly hotel located on the canal”
Reviews.Author: soccerdeb
Reviews.Content: we visit indianapolis often and wanted to walk the canal waterway this trip so choose the residence inn for a different experience. the staff were extremely helpful, even offering a parking pass for my intown relatives to use. they offer a great hot breakfast and evening wine,beer, and light supper menu. rooms were bright, clean and the canal walkway was enjoyable. although a little pricier than we like to spend, it was a great mini get away.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: GirlGenius0628
Reviews.Content: Everything was great at this hotel! The staff was amazing, they were almost overly helpful! They booked my dinner reservations, gave me a map of downtown and showed me everything there was to do within walking distance. The manager even called another Marriott (on the same property) and found me some super glue when I had broken flip flop! If I were driving I would have been a little ticked about the $12/day parking. The free breakfast was so good, it was worth paying for. Other than the parking, my room 108 was right next to the alternate exit and the door slammed all night, I am sure if I would have complained that they would have moved me. I can't say enough good things about this hotel! The best thing is, I named my own price on Priceline and got it for $40/night!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff!”
Reviews.Author: MisplacedOhioan
Reviews.Content: Checked in yesterday and without exception every member of the staff we've encountered has been cheerful, professional and very helpful. The building itself is a little tired (and yes, balconies would have been a great idea), but the rooms are clean and quiet and you can't beat the location. The staff at the front desk has been kept hopping (LOTS of families here this week-end), but we've never had to wait too long for assistance. I'd absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience the Canal Walk

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IrishFrau
Reviews.Content: We found the front desk staff to be amazingly friendly; they greeted us whenever we returned to the hotel. The breakfast staff was equally friendly - one even offered to make a waffle for our teenager who was stil sleeping. Several museums were within walking distance. Our key card allowed a discount at Buca di beppo, which served massive quantities of Italian food. A couple could easily split a salad and entree and have food to bring back to the hotel to put in the fridge. This would be a great place for a family get together as there is a large common room on the lower level, canal side, which has a game table and a large seating area. We found the hot tub relaxing, with not too many chemicals. We will return, bringing family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: CodaMing
Reviews.Content: The location is nice. On the Canal, in the city, but not right in the center of the busy part. The room was decent. We were given the wrong size bed but did not complain. A bit over priced, but I think the whole city was. The pool and hot tube were closed duting my stay which was the biggest upset. Something I looked forward to, relaxing after a long day of traveling around. They told us to go across the parking lot to the other Marriott, not convenient at all, especially in the rain and defeats the point of relaxing. We went anyway & the front desk laughed! Breakfast was the best part! The really put out a spread! Sucked to pay extra for parking ...

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn should be ashamed!”
Reviews.Author: dc4168
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Residence Inns and usually love the chain. This one is terrible. The hotel needs updating and a very deep cleaning. Or better yet they should tear it down and start over. Our room was very very dirty. At first I thought that they gave us the wrong room and maybe the one they gave us had not been cleaned yet. Too many problems to name but trust me, do not stay here. There are plenty of nicer hotels in the same price range or other very nice Residence Inns not far from downtown. I can not figure out how this one is still in business.

Reviews.Title: “Below typical Residence Inn quality”
Reviews.Author: BT_Texas
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travel I try to stay in a Residence Inn, as it has never disappointed. However, I guess there is always a first. This is the first time I've ever stayed at a R.I. that was a studio room. One of the very reasons we prefer R.I. is because I usually wake up early and my husband is a night owl, so it is nice to have a separate den/bedroom so that we don't disturb each other. But this was one big room, with one TV that swiveled between the den and bedroom area. Additionally, the canal view for which we paid extra was disappointing. One of the things we always look forward to is the evening happy hour. But when we asked about it, the manager said that they had problems with the happy hour so eliminated it. And not that this should be any big deal but they rarely have cookies at the front desk, unlike at the other R.I.'s. I know it sounds like many petty things but when you add them all together, it just wasn't as fun of an experience as is usual at the R.I. The one thing that didn't disappoint was the breakfast - good as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Cookie-cutter suburban hotel dropped into the gorgeous canal area”
Reviews.Author: indianatrails
Reviews.Content: The area surround this hotel is absolutely gorgeous. However, the hotel itself pays virtually no homage to it. There is one common balcony on the main floor, but no seating. We had to drink coffee and eat in the lobby area. We might as well have been on the freeway in the suburbs. There is no seating on the canal level or any other treatment or features to engage guests with the canal. The canal-facing rooms have no balconies, and the windows were very dirty. We wanted to open them but they could only be opened about 3 inches, not enough to get fresh air or the sounds of the nearby fountains. What we did hear were the blasts of the other guests' air conditioning units, which are mounted right outside the windows and partially blocking the view. This was a cookie-cutter hotel designed for the suburbs, parking lot and all. No personality or charm whatsoever. The staff was exceptionally pleasant, however. The room, food and other accommodations were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Old & Worn Out-Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: thecrossbowkid
Reviews.Content: I am staying in Indy for the next 2 months and despite being a Silver member and getting the points, I am seriously considering checking out and heading to the Candlewood Suites. Problems: The "Canal" which is billed as so scenic is drained, so it is an icy muddy trench now. The smell of the hotel is mildly unpleasant, probably due to its age. Definitely needs refurbishment. Rooms are a little worn & faded with cracks in the bathrooms. The breakfasts are just so-so and the happy hour food is prison grade- overcooked mac and cheese, runny tacos, and sloppy joes made from yesterdays tacos with very littlle meat and a big bowl of frozen & wilted iceburg lettuce and potato chips constitute the fine dining here. Oh, and there's a nacho cheese dispenser to remind you that this is the Midwest. Bad. I don't care if the food is free- don't eat it. I am paying a rate of $150 a night, too much for what you get. The indoor pool is shallow, & small and they use alot of strong chemicals in the hottub which burn your throat. The good news is, the pool seems almost always empty- gee I wonder why? I have stayed at several Residence Inns before and this one is easily the worst. Hope this helps someone.... .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lots of conveniences..”
Reviews.Author: gumballmachine
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here for one night for a little getaway and had a great time. The hotel is typical of other Residence Inns in that it is set up suite style with a full kitchen, living area and separate bedroom. The bedroom did have a door but it isn't a typical door that closes all the way or locks so if you are adults traveling with other adults you may want a little more privacy. Plus, the one bathroom is only accessible by entering the bedroom. The living area has the pull out sofa for the kids and a 2nd tv which is handy but like most sofabeds it is not terribly large or comfortable. My kids did okay but would have liked more room. The kitchen is well equiped with all the utensils you might need and includes a fridge, microwave, stove and coffeemaker. They also include the coffee, tea and microwave popcorn. We ate out for lunch and were able to reheat the leftovers for dinner. The hotel offers a free breakfast buffet that consists of the usual continental items plus hot items like eggs, sausage, waffles, etc. The location of the property was perfect for our needs. We could walk (about 6 blocks or so) to the basketball game and it was a short (5 minute) drive to the Museum of Art. The girl at the front desk was super friendly and printed out the Mapquest directions to and from (there are many one way streets downtown so returning was different.) We had a room on the canal but as previously mentioned it was drained so it was ugly but we didn't really care about the view or lack there of. They do charge for parking but it was under 10 bucks and is the norm for downtown. We brought our laptop and there was free internet access in the room. I think I remember seeing a public computer in the lobby as well. Overall we had a nice stay. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly. The amenities were very convenient for family travel. The hotel is not 4 star resort but we weren't looking for that this time so we were very satisfied. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 123anddone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in a 2-bedroom suite on the first floor overlooking the canal. Tasha checked us in and was more than helpful. She was smiling all the time, very friendly ... somebody enjoying her work. The room was OK, not the most modern, but not very old either. Everything worked fine, space was fine. Plenty of towels, 2 cribs delivered to our room promptly. Overnight parking is $12 per day (in and out is not a problem). Breakfast as any other Residence Inn, pretty clean and nice sitting area. Overall, just a decent Residence Inn with very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: smr_1212
Reviews.Content: My mom and I have stayed at this Residence Inn 5 times over the past 3 years. On our first stay in July 2005, we received a two-bedroom suite facing the canal on the lowest floor. The view was very nice, and we really enjoyed our stay. Coincidentally, we were given the same room for our second stay in October 2005 and had an equally excellent stay. For our third and fourth stays, in April and November 2006, we requested and received the same room again. We once again experienced no problems. Unfortunately, our fifth stay did not live up to expectations. Previously, the hotel had not charged for parking in its lot, but this must have recently changed, as it was now $12. Apparently, it is now open to the public for parking also. We were somewhat unhappy to be suddenly paying $12 for uncovered parking that wasn't even right downtown, but we were willing to live with it. What we weren't willing to live with was our treatment at the front desk upon check-in. We dealt with a woman named Connie. I couldn't honestly say Connie was outright rude; she pretended to be pleasant and came across as rather condescending. She proceeded to "welcome" us by very insincerely telling us she was sorry but we would be unable to stay in the room we'd requested. She then gave us another room but quickly switched us to yet another for some reason she did not impart to us. We realized as we set off toward the room that it would not be facing the canal and returned to the front desk to ask if such a room was available. Of course, Connie told us it was not. When we reached our room, my mom was surprised to find it was handicapped, as Connie had failed to mention it. She should've given us this information since the the kitchen table only seated two and one bathroom contained only a shower rather than a bathtub/shower. Luckily we were flexible and did not expect to seat more than two for a meal. Nevertheless, Connie must have been able to sense our earlier frustration because a small box of chocolates was promptly delivered to our door. While this was probably hotel policy, it seemed like a shallow and inadequate fix for her unwelcoming attitude. The room was pretty clean, with only a bit of food still stuck to the kitchen table. In fact, housekeeping was very good for the rest of our stay. However, we encountered a great number of gnats in our room, especially around our bathroom sinks. We hadn't left any windows open, so we had no idea where they came from. My mom also had to dispose of a large red spider in her bathroom. We assume that had crawled in from a door left open down the hall, but we really didn't know. In addition, my bedroom did not have an alarm clock, and we never received a calendar showing the planned meals or area events that had always been provided. Probably the worst part of our stay was our noisy upstairs neighbor. We think it was one person, but he or she sounded like a herd of elephants. Like all travelers, we're used to some noise from other rooms, but we were constantly in fear that this person would fall through the ceiling as he thundered above. Our neighbor was virtually always home when we were and seemed never to sit down but instead to stomp very, very loudly across the room hitting everything in sight. Sadly, we couldn't call the front desk because we were sure Connie would tell him that we, in our specific room number, were complaining. We had no further contact with the front desk after check-in and avoided even walking by it. We were able to drop our key cards in a slot as we left the parking lot. After having had great experiences with the staff and accommodations on four previous occasions, we could not have been more disappointed. I would no longer recommend the hotel to friends, and I'm not sure I'd stay there again myself. My mom says she'd probably stay there again but only if she knew for certain she could get a room with a canal view. My advice to travelers is to look further. I can only hope that Connie is no longer working at the hotel if you do stay there. On our way down the canal, we passed the windows of our requested room numerous times, and each time the curtains were partially open and no lights were on. This led us to suspect that the room was unoccupied, and Connie had simply decided not to honor our request for some strange reason. That probably sounds paranoid, but I've never encountered anyone quite like her in years of staying at Residence Inns.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Indianapolis Downtown on the Canal
HotelInfo.Address: 350 W New York Street, Indianapolis, IN 46202
